trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Filtering"></xref> event of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource"></xref> control.

The SqlDataSourceFilteringEventArgs class is used to pass data to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Filtering> event handler of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceFilteringEventArgs.ParameterValues%2A> property provides access to the filter parameter values before the filtering operation is performed.

You can cancel the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select%2A> method by setting the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceFilteringEventArgs> to `true`.
Filtering is supported when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.DataSourceMode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceMode> value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceFilteringEventArgs"></xref> class by using the specified object.

The parameters in the `parameterValues` collection are associated with any parameters that are specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterExpression%2A> property when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.Select%2A> method runs.

Gets an <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> object that provides access to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> objects of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceFilteringEventArgs> class is used to pass data to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Filtering> event handler of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource>.
The ParameterValues property provides access to the filter parameter values before the filtering operation is performed.
> [!IMPORTANT] > You should validate any filter parameter values that you receive from the client and cancel the select operation if there are invalid parameters.
The runtime simply substitutes the parameter value into the filter expression and applies it to the result of the select method.
It is possible for compromised values to alter the filter expression in such a way as to reveal more rows than might otherwise be visible to the client.

If you are using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterExpression%2A> property as a security measure to limit the number of items that are returned, you must validate the parameter values before the filtering occurs.
